column4: Hi, the fan on my computer goes at full speed in Ubuntu and is very noisy. How can I get it to slow down?
that could be an ACPI problem. And if it's that, it can't be easily solved because of Microsoft vendors lock-ins
what manufacturer is your PC?
did it come with Windows Vista?
Yes.
it's Asus M2N-SLI AM2
are you sure it's the mainboard/cpu fan and not the GPU(Graphic card) fan? btw, is it a desktop?
I'm not sure where the noise comes from exactly to be honest. It is a desktop.
could you try to put the mouse behind the graphics card in windows and linux to find out if its a GPU problem?
nVidia recently had problems with fans on their GPUs, so...
did i say mouse? god.. i meant hand
i have lost my mind somewhere... Australia i guess
I just opened the hardware options and a message popped up to say the nvidia graphics driver isn't installed.
maybe that's the problem, try to install it and let me know the results :)
downloading now
do you have Ubuntu 10.04?
i encourage you to update (but do a clean install)
what's better about 10.04?
nouveau, for example, it's a new open source driver for nVidia :)
apart from faster startup times, and improved speed
but it's all up to you, obviously :)
I'm happy with the startup times / speed I currently have.  I was quite pleased with the new features last time I upgraded Ubuntu so I might give it a whirl in the future.
